intro: Melastoma septemnervium, commonly known as the seven-veined melastoma, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Asia and the Pacific. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with seven prominent veins. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often followed by red or orange berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions, though it can become invasive in certain ecosystems.
